sentence.Network_en: He had been swept aside in the whirlwind of reform and anarchy.
sentence.Network_cn: 在改革和无政府状态交织的混乱风暴中，他被抛在了一边，没人理睬。

sentence.Network_en: I had been running around southern England in a whirlwind of activity.
sentence.Network_cn: 我一直奔忙于英格兰南部地区，疲于应对一连串的活动。

sentence.Network_en: He got married after a whirlwind romance.
sentence.Network_cn: 在一场旋风式的恋爱后他很快就结婚了。

phrase.cizu_name: (sow the wind and) reap the whirlwind

jx.jx_en_mean: suffer serious consequences as a result of one's actions

entry.def: A whirlwind is a tall column of air which spins round and round very fast and moves across the land or sea.
You can describe a situation in which a lot of things happen very quickly and are very difficult for someone to control as a whirlwind .

example.ex: I had been running around southern England in a whirlwind of activity...
example.tran: 我一直奔忙于英格兰南部地区，疲于应对一连串的活动。

example.ex: He had been swept aside in the whirlwind of reform and anarchy.
example.tran: 在改革和无政府状态交织的混乱风暴中，他被抛在了一边，没人理睬。

entry.tran: 旋风般的;匆匆忙忙的;快速的
entry.def: A whirlwind event or action happens or is done much more quickly than normal.

example.ex: He got married after a whirlwind romance.
example.tran: 在一场旋风式的恋爱后他很快就结婚了。
走马观花式的法国之旅

means.word_mean: 1. a more or less vertical column of air whirling around itself as it moves over the surface of the Earth
